fields.description:
Update: The original 17 VMs on this machine are still stuck in this state after 68 hours. Restarting the eucalyptus-cloud service on the CLC did not clear the state. I have ~3 days of additional testing I haven't seen any more VMs get stuck in shutting-down, so maybe this is an artifact of eucanetd being unreachable during tear down?

I’m seeing a few errors during VPC load testing yesterday/today. The
current test is attempting to launch 5 VMs per account over 20-30
unique accounts concurrently. 100-150 VMs in total.  
There are about 17 instances which have been stuck in shutting-down
state for about 19 hours. This may be due/related to a eucanetd crash
([~dannurmi] provided fix already), but I don’t know if the front-end is even
aware of eucanetd’s state for it to result in this kind of error?
The logs have a fair amount of the exception shown below as well.
Topology/addresses shown at the bottom if anyone would like to poke
around.
Thanks!,
-M

fields.summary: VPC- VMs stuck in shutting down during load testing

comments.body: Possibly not easy to reproduce. [~sjones], please, take a look at this specific system.
It looks like this is occurring for instances that do not have a node tag. [~mclark], does that match what you were seeing?
We now timeout shutdown of instances in the case that they do not have a node tag. The error on concurrent update of subnet free addresses is also fixed.

Thanks for the update [~sjones], I'm going to close this as I wasn't able to reproduce after upgrading, running new stress tests, and running terminate on a 'stopped' instances w/o a node tag.  I'll reopen if it pops up again.
